required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Topical Naloxone to Diagnose Ocular Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Topical Naloxone Hydrochloride as a Diagnostic Tool for Ocular Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic ocular neuropathic pain may be misdiagnosed as dry eye disease. Our study aims to identify a population with previous monocular trauma and dry eye symptoms and differentiate neuropathic from dry eye pain using topical corneal naloxone hydrochloride.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Response to Hypertonic Saline (Muro 128) drop
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after hypertonic drop administered. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The pain response is graded using a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) survey. It is graded 1-10; 10 indicates the most severe pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At any point during study visit. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: This 12 question survey measures your recent dry eye symptoms using the ocular surface index scale. The scale has a low score of 10 and high score of 100. A higher score means you have worse dry eye symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after hypertonic saline drop. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: This test examines many areas of your eye (cornea, lids, inner eye) using a microscope.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after hypertonic saline drop. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: A yellow staining dye will be applied to your cornea that will allow us to examine the structural integrity of your cornea.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after hypertonic saline drop. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure will be measured via Tono-Pen.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after hypertonic saline drop. Measured during both study visits, thus through study completion, an expected average of 4 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: will be measured using ETDRS letter grading system. Your grade will depend on your ability to read small print.

arm_group.description: This arm will receive 0.02 mg naloxone hcl on the experimental visit and balance salt solution on the control visit.
This arm will receive 0.08 mg naloxone hcl on the experimental visit and balance salt solution on the control visit.

intervention.description: Drug will be topically applied to the corneal surface then study evaluations will ensue.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- monocular trauma
- dry eye disease diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- any pathology that might contribute to ocular pain, including corneal surface ulcers, uveitis, or other chronic inflammatory processes
- any current corneal surface pathology
- history of bilateral ocular trauma
- currently taking any of the following medications: TCAs, opioids, gabapentin, SNRIs
- pregnant nor breastfeeding.
